intro: Apteranthes europaea, commonly known as European false nettle, is a low-growing perennial herb native to Europe. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often edible or medicinal properties. The plant features slender, erect stems covered with fine hairs and lance-shaped leaves with prominent veins. Its small, greenish-white flowers are arranged in clusters and bloom in early summer. Apteranthes europaea is typically found in moist, calcareous soils in woodland edges and meadows.
